intro: Pimpinella hispida, commonly known as the hairy cow-weed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Pimpinella hispida is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions.
